title: 820-00165 usb port doesnt detect mouse or small powered usb
message:
hi, this macbook came in with some backlight damage, fixed that.
Found out j4600 usb port has some problem. It will detect hard drive fine, but if pluged with mouse or wireless mouse receiver, or any small powered usb,it doesnt work.
The other usb port is working fine. 
There's 5v on each side of L4600.
usb_pwr_en is 3.3v

I have tried replacing U4650 and U4600, but still the same, any idea ?

title: 820-00165 usb port doesnt detect mouse or small powered usb
message:
Seems to have problems with USB 2.0 communication.
Did you check L4600?
U4650 can be removed and bypassed (1-7/2-6).

title: 820-00165 usb port doesnt detect mouse or small powered usb
message:
L4600 is good, theres 5v on both side.
bypassed u4650,pin 1 to 7, 2 to 6, but still same, not detect wireless mouse / wired mouse.

title: 820-00165 usb port doesnt detect mouse or small powered usb
message:
5V on L4600, really?
BTW, it has 4 pins...

title: 820-00165 usb port doesnt detect mouse or small powered usb
message:
sry I meant, L4605 has 5v on both side.
L4600 has good continuity on both side and same value too.

title: 820-00165 usb port doesnt detect mouse or small powered usb
message:
Diode mode to ground correct on both sides (left/right) of L4600?
Keep the bypass on U4650.

title: 820-00165 usb port doesnt detect mouse or small powered usb
message:
diode mode is 0.420 on all pin ( 1-4 )
on known good board without the u4650 bypass, diode mode is 0.650 on both side left and right side, is this acceptable ?

title: 820-00165 usb port doesnt detect mouse or small powered usb
message:
Values look correct.
You should compare with the readings on pins 6/7 for good board.

Check J4600 for damaged pins, or corrosion.

title: 820-00165 usb port doesnt detect mouse or small powered usb
message:
I see you in other post recommending people to try remove the diode,even though measurement is good, just in case.
so i tried removing d4600 and d4601, and sure enough they start to work lol. I thought diode only died by shorting itself, but it can interfere like this..
Replaced with donor's, and usb 2 is now working, Thank you very much sir!!
